candidates.name: Richard Shelby
candidates.bio: Born in Birmingham, Alabama, Richard Shelby attended the University of Alabama and worked as a prosecuter until the beginning his politial career. He has been serving in the Alabama State Senate, US House, and Senate since 1970. Interestingly, he swicthed his party affilication from Democratic to Republican in 1994.

platformPoints.point1: Opposed to illegal immigration and pushes stronger law enforcement
platformPoints.point2: Against the Affordable Care Act and wishes to preserve the old heath care system
platformPoints.point3: Advocate of the Pro-life movement and supports policies to protect unborn

candidates.name: Marcus Bowman
candidates.bio: Born and raised in Elgin, Illinois, 42 year-old Marcus Bowman resides in Daphne, Alabama. He attended Iowa State University and has lead a small business owner and has experience with legal matters in Washington, D.C. He was raised with Christian and conservative values and those opinions guide his political decisions.

platformPoints.point1: Advocates state level decisions on marriage and abortion
platformPoints.point2: Committed to only serving one term to ensure personal motivation
platformPoints.point3: Seeks to eliminate perks for members of congress

candidates.name: John Martin
candidates.bio: Born in Mississippi, John Martin boasts of a 40 year military career. He has served as an army pilot, army civilian, and contractor. He seeks to represent Alabama's conservative values as Senator.

platformPoints.point1: Supports improving treatment of veterans
platformPoints.point2: Believes that environmental legislation should be a state, not federal issue
platformPoints.point3: Opposed to the Common Core curriculum and seeks to improve educational system

candidates.name: Jonathan Mcconnell
candidates.bio: After having grown up in Mobile, Alabama, Jonathan Mcconnell served in the US Marine Corps. He then pursused his law degree at the University of Alabama. After obtaining his degree, he founded a successful maritime security company.

platformPoints.point1: Opposed to gun control and dedicated to upholding the 2nd ammendment
platformPoints.point2: Supports entrepreneurs and small businesses
platformPoints.point3: Promotes free international trade

candidates.name: Shadrack McGill
candidates.bio: McGill attended North Alabama Community College and is has owned several businesses. He started his political served in the Alabama State Senate for 4 years. He now resides with his wife and children in Scottsboro and works as the operator of Hydraulic Seals and Service.

platformPoints.point1: Seeks to improve economy and unemployment rate
platformPoints.point2: Supports local funding of educational systems
platformPoints.point3: Dedicated to moral reform of the political system.

candidates.name: Charles Nana
candidates.bio: Nana was born in Cameroon, South Africa, but migrated to the United States later in life. He has degrees from Howard University, Catholic University of America, and the University of Chicago. Since he has become a successful businessman.

platformPoints.point1: Opposes international trade practices that harm American business
platformPoints.point2: Intends to battle the issue of prescription drug overdose
platformPoints.point3: Dedicated to fight the curruption in the university administrative system

candidates.name: Ron Crumpton
candidates.bio: Crumpton originally started his career in landscaping, but decided to attend the University of Alabama at Birmingham when an injury prevented him from continuing in his current line of work. Since then, he has worked on legislation regarding patient care and the use of marijuana for medical and recreational purposes.

platformPoints.point1: Opposes gun control
platformPoints.point2: Supports farmers who want to cultivate hemp

candidates.name: Lisa Murkowski
candidates.bio: Born in Ketchikan, Alaska, Murkowski attended Georgetown University and Willamette College of Law. After receiving her degree she worked as an attorney for 10 years. She then served in the House of Representatives and moved to the Senate in 2002.

platformPoints.point1: Involved in legislation aimed at combatting the war on women
platformPoints.point2: Opposes providing opportunities for illegal immigrants to become citizens
platformPoints.point3: Advocates the requirement for hiring women and minorities

candidates.name: Thomas Lamb
candidates.bio: Lamb resides in Anchorage, Alaska. He maintains a blog where he writes regularly and passionately about political issues that are significant to him.

platformPoints.point1: Opposes Sarah Palin and her supporters
platformPoints.point2: Offended at Ellen DeGeneres's silence at a picture of a child stepping on a dog's back
platformPoints.point3: Rejects proposal to build gasline in Alaska

candidates.name: Cean Stevens
candidates.bio: Lamb was born in San Bernardino, CA and is a business owner. She ran for House in 2012, but was unsuccessful. She resides in Anchorage, Alaska with her family.

platformPoints.point1: Dedicated to cutting state spending
platformPoints.point2: Supports distribution of property to Alaskans
platformPoints.point3: Advocates free market solutions

candidates.bio: Clark served in the army and the Arizona National Guard. Now, he works as a music teacher and is a progressive activist.

candidates.name: Ann Kirkpatrick
candidates.bio: Kirkpatrick grew up on a family ranch in the Eastern Arizona mountains. She attended the University of Arizona and then began a career in law. In 2004, she served in the House of Representatives and then in Congress.

platformPoints.point1: Advocates finding alternative energy sources and preserving the environment
platformPoints.point2: Dedicated to reviving the working middle class
platformPoints.point3: Promises to fight to protect the social security and medicare programs

candidates.name: John McCain
candidates.bio: McCain served in the US Navy from 1954 to 1981. He began his political career in 1982 when he joined the House of Representatives and switched to the Senate in 1986. The current senator is best known for his candidicy in the 2008 presidential election.

platformPoints.point1: Opposes gun control and fights for gun rights
platformPoints.point2: Supports Native American rights

candidates.name: Alex Meluskey
candidates.bio: Meluskey attended the College of New Jersey and went on to become the owner and operator of a printing company. He is politically active in his community where he resides with his wife and two children.

platformPoints.point1: Supports securing the border to prevent illegal immigration

platformPoints.point2: Advocates the reduction of the national debt

Steenwyk and his wife are active in the community, having started a faith-based outreach to serve others.

platformPoints.point1: Advocates rethinking alliences with nations who have supporte the Radical Islam Movement

platformPoints.point1: Opposes Obama Care and wants to repeal the act

candidates.bio: Boozman was born in Shreveport, Louisiana, and attended the University of Arkansas and the Southern College of Optometry. platformPoints.point1: Supports the The Energy Tax Prevention Act
platformPoints.point2: Opposes the national debt and advocates
platformPoints.point3: Advocates the changing of the tax code to take the burden off of small businesses

candidates.bio: Coleman attended Central Baptist College, Southern Arkansas University, and Southwestern Baptist Theological Seminary. He also has experience as a small business owner, having founded an international food safety company. Coleman retired in 2009 and is active in state and federal poliics.

candidates.name: Conner Eldridge

candidates.name: Frank Gilbert
candidates.bio: After high school graduation, Gilbert served in the Navy from 1968 to 1972. He then attended Ouachita Baptist University and began his 20 year career at an alarm company which he now is a manager of. The candidate has also served as mayor, coroner, and is now a minister.

platformPoints.point1: Supports same-sex marriage

candidates.bio: Borth in Oakland, California, Harris attended Howard University and the University of California, Hastings College of the Law. She began her career as an attorney and eventually became Attorney General of California. Harris is the first woman, American-Asian, and African American to have this political role in California's history.

platformPoints.point1: Supports justice system reform and treating serious offenders unequally

candidates.bio: Sanchez attended Chapman University and received her MBA from American University. She began her political career in 1996 when she was elected for congress. Interestingly, Loretta and her sister, Linda, are the first two sisters to serve in congress simultaneously in the state of California.

platformPoints.point1: Dedicated to improving our homeland security
platformPoints.point2: Prioritizes job generation and economic growth

He also is an author and his work has been featured on several famous poliical websites. Beccaro currently resides in the San Francisco Bay area and works as a business attorney and businessman.

platformPoints.point1: Advocates flat tax for the state and national level

candidates.bio: Sundheim attended Stanford University and received his law degree from Northwestern University. He began his career as an attorney and also served as the chairman of the California Republican Party. He currently owns his own business and works as a judge.

candidates.bio: Graham is a former successful businessman in the reinsurance industry. He also worked as director of athletics at Colorado State University. Since announcing his plans to run for senate, he has provided $1 million of his own money to his own campaign.

platformPoints.point1: Needs more time to establish personal stance in issues

candidates.bio: Keyser graduated from the Air Force Academy and served overseas in combat in both Iraq and Afghanistan. He also served in the Air Force as an intelligence officer. He also attended University of Denver for a law degree and was elected to the House of Representatives in 2013.

platformPoints.point1: Supports the pro-life movement and fights to defund Planned Parenthood

She began her political career in 2008 when she was elected to serve in the House of Representatives.

platformPoints.point1: Advocates for expanding Medicare and Social Security
platformPoints.point2: Supports same-sex marriage and LGBTQ rights
platformPoints.point3: Promotes enforcing gun control

candidates.name: Jason Kander
candidates.bio: Kander began his career by serving in the Army National Guard and attended Georgetown University for a law degree while serving in Georgetown's ROTC battalion. After a military tour in Afghanistan, he taught at the Missouri National Guard's Officer Candidate School. In 2008, he was elected to the Missouri House of Representatives and then as the Missouri Secretary of State.

platformPoints.point1: Advocates for women and fights human sex trafficking
platformPoints.point2: Supports campaign financial and ethical reform
platformPoints.point3: Promotes solutions for small business

candidates.name: Catherine Cortez Masto
candidates.bio: Catherine was born in Las Vegas, Nevada and attended the University of Nevada and Gonzaga University School of Law. She worked as a civil attorney and a prosecuter before serving as Nevada Attorney General. Catherine resides in Las Vegas with her husband.

platformPoints.point1: Promises to protect Medicade and Social Security for senior citizens
platformPoints.point2: Advocates raising the minimum wage
platformPoints.point3: Opposes the Citizens United decision

candidates.name: Maggie Hassan
candidates.bio: Hassan was born in Boston and attended Brown University and Northeastern School of Law. She worked as an attorney at various firms and counsels from 1985 to 1999. In 2004, she began her political career when she was elected to serve in the New Hampshire Senate.

platformPoints.point1: Dedicated to combatting the heroin and opioid crisis
platformPoints.point2: Develops environment where businesses can thrive and unemployment decreases
platformPoints.point3: Protects the natural resources vital to New Hampshire's economy

candidates.name: Chuck Schumer
candidates.bio: Schumer was born in Brooklyn, NY and attended Harvard College and Harvard Law School. He immediately began his political career, having been elected to the New York State Assembly in 1974 and to the House of Representatives in 1980. He has served New York as senator for 16 years.

platformPoints.point1: Opposes nuclear deal with Iran
platformPoints.point2: Supports the Affordable Care Act
platformPoints.point3: Fights to secure homeland security funds

candidates.name: Greg Brannon
candidates.bio: Brannon attended the University of Southern California and Chicago Medical School. He began his career by setting up his own successful obstetrics practice. To support his pro-life views, Greg is also a board member for a pregnancy support group and member of a pro-life organization for doctors.

platformPoints.point1: Supports giving local farmers control of their property
platformPoints.point2: Promises transparency regarding the Federal Reserve
platformPoints.point3: Opposes same-sex marriage

candidates.name: John Hoeven
candidates.bio: Hoeven was born in Bismarck and attended Dartmouth College and Northwestern University. He served as vice president, president, and CEO to numerous companies before being elected to State Governer. He has served as State Senator since 2010.

platformPoints.point1: Supports farmers facing agricultural concerns
platformPoints.point2: Advocates international partnership with Asia-Pacific region
platformPoints.point3: Promises to restore and improve statewide water infrastructure

candidates.name: Ted Strickland
candidates.bio: Sticklnd was born in Lucasville, Ohio and attended Asbury College, Asbury Theological Seminary, and the University of Kentucky. Strickland worked as a prison psychologist, a minister, and a professor. He began his poliical career in 1992 when he was elected to serve in the House of Representatives.

platformPoints.point1: Fights for equal pay for women
platformPoints.point2: Supports making higher education debt-free
platformPoints.point3: Opposes Citizens United and works to overturn decision

candidates.name: James Lankford
candidates.bio: Lankford grew up in Dallas, Texas and attended the University of Texas at Austin and Southwestern Baptist Theological Seminary. He began his career working as a director for a large Christian camp before he was elected to the House of Representatives in 2010. He has served as Senator since 2014.

platformPoints.point1: Promotes reforming the No Child Left Behind Act
platformPoints.point2: Supports the Keystone XL Pipeline
platformPoints.point3: Opposes the Iran Nuclear Agreement

candidates.name: Ron Wyden
candidates.bio: Wyden was born in Wichita, Kansas and attended the University of California, Stanford University, and University of Oregon School of Law. He began his career teaching gerontology and co-founded an support group for the elderly. Wyden served 7 terms in the House of Representatives and has been senator since 1996.

platformPoints.point1: Protects the wilderness of Oregon
platformPoints.point2: Opposes the war in Iraq and fights to bring troops home
platformPoints.point3: Supports victims of sex trafficking

candidates.name: Joe Sestak
candidates.bio: Sestak was born in Delaware County, Pennsylvania and attended U.S. Naval Academy. He then served in the Navy for over 30 years and was awarded many military decorations. In 2006, he began his political career when he was elected to serve in the House of Representatives.

platformPoints.point1: Focuses on finding environmentally friendly solutions
platformPoints.point2: Protects those with Alzheimer’s in the Elder Abuse Victims Act
platformPoints.point3: Supports legislation to legalize medical marijuana

candidates.name: Joyce Dickerson
candidates.bio: Dickerson grew up in Savannah, Georgia and attended Benedict College and Midlands Technical College. She began her career as an auditor and worked until 2006. The candidate ran for senator in 2014 unsuccessfully, but did win the primary elections.

platformPoints.point1: Prioritizes reducing the national debt
platformPoints.point2: Promotes improved treatment of verterans
platformPoints.point3: Supports immigration reform for illegal immigrants

candidates.name: John Thune
candidates.bio: Thune was raised in Murdo, South Dakota and attended Biola University and the University of South Dakota. After graduation, he worked as a small business administrator, state railroad director, and executive director of the South Dakota Municipal League. In 1996, Thune was elected to the House of Representatives and has serve in the senate since 2004.

platformPoints.point1: Seeks to improve conditions for Indian reservations
platformPoints.point2: Suports securing the border and enforcing immigration laws
platformPoints.point3: Opposes ObamaCare and fights to repeal it

candidates.name: Mike Lee
candidates.bio: Lee was born in Mesa, Arizona and attended Brigham Young University and J. Reuben Clark Law School. He began his career serving as a law clerk and became an attorney. He has been serving in the US senate since 2010.

platformPoints.point1: Supports protection of gun rights
platformPoints.point2: Advocates for tax reform
platformPoints.point3: Promotes justice system reform and treating serious offenders unequally

candidates.name: Patrick Leahy
candidates.bio: Leahy was born in Montpelier and attended College in Colchester and Georgetown University Law Center. He began his career as an asociate in a firm and later became the State's Attorney of Chittenden County. When he became senator in 1974, was the youngest Senator in Vermont history to be elected.

platformPoints.point1: Works to conserve state's farmland
platformPoints.point2: Supports finding alternative, renewable forms of energy
platformPoints.point3: Strives to provide affordable housing

candidates.name: Chris Vance
candidates.bio: Vance was born in Seattle and attended Western Washington University. He began his career working for a congressman then transitioned to a job as a research analyst. He served in the State House of Representatives from 1991 to 1993 and is currenty a small business owner.

platformPoints.point1: Opposes federal funding of abortions
platformPoints.point2: Promises to fight gridlock and filibuster in the senate
platformPoints.point3: Supports strengthening, not eradicating Social Security and Medicare

candidates.name: Russ Feingold
candidates.bio: Feingold was born in Janesville, Wisconsin and attended the University of Wisconsin, the University of Oxford, and Harvard Law School. He worked as an attoney for a small firm and was elected to the Wisconsin Senate in 1982. He served in the US Senate from 1992 to 2010 and is now running for re-election.

platformPoints.point1: Supports same-sex marriage and voted against Defense of Marriage Act
platformPoints.point2: Opposes the Patriot Act
platformPoints.point3: Advocates for Wall Street reform
